The world would become a much more peaceful place, with fewer deaths and injuries, and less destruction of property and infrastructure.
Resources would be redirected towards humanitarian aid and development projects, rather than towards military spending and armaments.
The global economy would likely improve, as countries would be able to focus on production and trade without the burden of war.
The environment would also benefit, as the resources and technology used in warfare would be redirected towards sustainable development.
However, it is also possible that the sudden end of all wars could lead to a power vacuum and instability, as nations and groups struggle to adapt to a world without conflict.
